We cannot live without humanity for many reasons, but here are two of the most important reasons. Humans are, by necessity, pack animals. Individually, we can’t know everything we have to know in order to survive on our own. Yes, there have been exceptions, especially in the beginning, perhaps. Now, it would be too exhausting for one person to start fires, hunt for meat, forage for food, cook, make clothing and shelter, collect water, protect ourselves against predators, and prepare for nature.We are fragile creatures. For cuts and scrapes, and with the right knowledge and equipment, we can avoid diseases and infections from cuts and abrasions. For something more serious, like lacerations, broken bones, amputations, etc., we need partners. As a species, we cannot survive without helpers in case of emergencies. For each injury, we are taking time away from the other essential activities listed in #1. As a species, we would be doomed.Aside from the above, our mental health has been proven to be stronger when we spend time with like individuals. This does not necessarily mean family. They can often stress us more than strangers. Each kind act you accomplish each day adds to your mental health bank. You can be kind to animals and trees, but they don’t give you the same immediate gratitude (hugs, verbal thanks, rewards) as people. Enjoy humanity, feed positive energy into it and it will feed positive energy back.
